required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Safety and Change in Disease Symptoms of Risankizumab (Skyrizi Prefilled Syringe for Injection) in Adult Participants With Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: Post-Marketing Surveillance to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of Risankizumab (Skyrizi Prefilled Syringe for Injection) in Adult Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
Plaque Psoriasis is a chronic inflammatory disease in which skin cells build up and develop scaly red and white patches on the skin. It is caused by an overactive immune system where the body attacks healthy tissue by mistake. This study will evaluate how safe risankizumab is for the treatment of plaque psoriasis and to assess change in disease symptoms.
Risankizumab is an approved drug for the treatment of psoriasis. Around 3000 adult participants with a moderate to severe plaque psoriasis who had been prescribed risankizumab by their doctor will be enrolled in this study in multiple sites across Korea. The sample size for this study is a requirement by local authorities.
Participants will receive risankizumab prefilled syringe for injection for 52 weeks as prescribed by their physician.
There is expected to be no additional burden for participants in this study. All study visits will occur during routine clinical practice and participants will be followed for 52 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Reported Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. The investigator assesses the relationship of each event to the use of study. A serious adverse event (SAE) is an event that results in death, is life-threatening, requires or prolongs hospitalization, results in a congenital anomaly, persistent or significant disability/incapacity or is an important medical event that, based on medical judgment, may jeopardize the participant and may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent any of the outcomes listed above. Treatment-emergent adverse events/treatment-emergent serious adverse events (TEAEs/TESAEs) are defined as any event that began or worsened in severity on or after the first dose of study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Reported Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. The investigator assesses the relationship of each event to the use of study. A serious adverse event (SAE) is an event that results in death, is life-threatening, requires or prolongs hospitalization, results in a congenital anomaly, persistent or significant disability/incapacity or is an important medical event that, based on medical judgment, may jeopardize the participant and may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent any of the outcomes listed above. Treatment-emergent adverse events/treatment-emergent serious adverse events (TEAEs/TESAEs) are defined as any event that began or worsened in severity on or after the first dose of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving 75% Improvement in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI)
secondary_outcome.description: PASI is a clearly proven index that measures the clinical effectiveness of psoriasis treatment. PASI score ranges from 0 to 72 and assesses the overall psoriasis disease condition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving 75% Improvement in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI)
secondary_outcome.description: PASI is a clearly proven index that measures the clinical effectiveness of psoriasis treatment. PASI score ranges from 0 to 72 and assesses the overall psoriasis disease condition.

secondary_outcome.description: PASI is a clearly proven index that measures the clinical effectiveness of psoriasis treatment. PASI score ranges from 0 to 72 and assesses the overall psoriasis disease condition.

secondary_outcome.description: PASI is a clearly proven index that measures the clinical effectiveness of psoriasis treatment. PASI score ranges from 0 to 72 and assesses the overall psoriasis disease condition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean PASI Improvement Percentage
secondary_outcome.description: PASI is a clearly proven index that measures the clinical effectiveness of psoriasis treatment. PASI score ranges from 0 to 72 and assesses the overall psoriasis disease condition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Surface Area (BSA)
secondary_outcome.description: Decrease in BSA from baseline is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving an Static Physician Global Assessment (sPGA) Score of Clear or Almost Clear (0 or 1)
secondary_outcome.description: sPGA is a 6-point, 0-5 measure of psoriasis based on the average thickness, erythema, and induration of the plaque, as well as all the induration, erythema, scaling of the psoriasis lesions, evaluated by the physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving an Static Physician Global Assessment (sPGA) Score of Clear or Almost Clear (0 or 1)
secondary_outcome.description: sPGA is a 6-point, 0-5 measure of psoriasis based on the average thickness, erythema, and induration of the plaque, as well as all the induration, erythema, scaling of the psoriasis lesions, evaluated by the physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving an Static Physician Global Assessment (sPGA) Score of Clear (0)
secondary_outcome.description: sPGA is a 6-point, 0-5 measure of psoriasis based on the average thickness, erythema, and induration of the plaque, as well as all the induration, erythema, scaling of the psoriasis lesions, evaluated by the physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving an Static Physician Global Assessment (sPGA) Score of Clear (0)
secondary_outcome.description: sPGA is a 6-point, 0-5 measure of psoriasis based on the average thickness, erythema, and induration of the plaque, as well as all the induration, erythema, scaling of the psoriasis lesions, evaluated by the physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI)
secondary_outcome.description: The DLQI is assessed by self explanatory questionnaire consisting of ten quality of life questions and is calculated as a total of 30 points based on a maximum of 3 points per question. The higher the score, the more quality of life is impaired.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving a DLQI Score of 0 or 1
secondary_outcome.description: The DLQI is assessed by self explanatory questionnaire consisting of ten quality of life questions and is calculated as a total of 30 points based on a maximum of 3 points per question. The higher the score, the more quality of life is impaired.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a DLQI Score of 0 or 1
secondary_outcome.description: The DLQI is assessed by self explanatory questionnaire consisting of ten quality of life questions and is calculated as a total of 30 points based on a maximum of 3 points per question. The higher the score, the more quality of life is impaired.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving a Reduction of 5 or more Points from Baseline in DLQI Score
secondary_outcome.description: The DLQI is assessed by self explanatory questionnaire consisting of ten quality of life questions and is calculated as a total of 30 points based on a maximum of 3 points per question. The higher the score, the more quality of life is impaired.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Reduction of 5 or more Points from Baseline in DLQI Score
secondary_outcome.description: The DLQI is assessed by self explanatory questionnaire consisting of ten quality of life questions and is calculated as a total of 30 points based on a maximum of 3 points per question. The higher the score, the more quality of life is impaired.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Participants with Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis
arm_group.description: Participants will receive risankizumab (prefilled syringe for injection) as prescribed by the physician in routine clinical practice.

study_pop.textblock: Adult participants with moderate to severe plaque psoriasis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Suitable for the treatment with risankizumab according to the approved local label.
- Voluntarily agree to participate in this study and sign informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications to risankizumab as listed on the approved local label.
